com.tsgrp.migration.util

Class ImageAssembler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tsgrp.migration.util.ImageAssembler

  • public class ImageAssembler
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper around the com.lowagie.text package of iText that simplifies the creation of simple PDF files.
    Since:
    January 4, 2008

    • Method Detail

      • imagesToPdf

        public java.io.OutputStream imagesToPdf(java.lang.String[] input,
                                        java.lang.String output)
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Overloaded imagesToPdf method, since the boolean scaleImages parameter was added into the arguments. This method will call the overloaded method with scaleImages set to TRUE due to the original PDF code scalling the images as they were stiched into one PDF. The pdfaFormat variable will be set to false, so a PDF/A-3b compliant PDF is not created.
        Parameters:
        input - an array of image filenames to be placed in the output PDF
        output - the filename of the output PDF
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • imagesToPdf

        public java.io.OutputStream imagesToPdf(java.lang.String[] input,
                                        java.lang.String output,
                                        boolean scaleImages,
                                        boolean pdfaFormat)
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                        java.io.IOException,
                                        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        Convert a given array of image filenames into a single output PDF file. The input files can be of any image type that iText currently supports, including JPEG, PNG, GIF, and TIFF (one-page only!). The output PDF will consist of each image being placed one per page in the order listed in the input array. If scaleImages is true, they will be scaled to fit on a page if they are are larger than the set page size for the output PDF. Otherwise, the page size will be determined by the size of the image being added.
        Parameters:
        input - an array of image filenames to be placed in the output PDF
        output - the filename of the output PDF
        scaleImages - boolean to determine if images should be scaled in the PDF
        pdfaFormat - boolean to determine if pdf should be PDF/A-3b compliant
        Throws:
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • imagesToPdf

        public java.io.OutputStream imagesToPdf(java.lang.String[] input,
                                        java.lang.String output,
                                        boolean scaleImages,
                                        boolean pdfaFormat,
                                        boolean createPdfInMemory)
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                        java.io.IOException,
                                        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        Convert a given array of image filenames into a single output PDF file. The input files can be of any image type that iText currently supports, including JPEG, PNG, GIF, and TIFF (one-page only!). The output PDF will consist of each image being placed one per page in the order listed in the input array. If scaleImages is true, they will be scaled to fit on a page if they are are larger than the set page size for the output PDF. Otherwise, the page size will be determined by the size of the image being added.
        Parameters:
        input - an array of image filenames to be placed in the output PDF
        output - the filename of the output PDF
        scaleImages - boolean to determine if images should be scaled in the PDF
        pdfaFormat - boolean to determine if pdf should be PDF/A-3b compliant
        createPdfInMemory - boolean to determine if the pdf should be written to a file
        Throws:
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • addOneImageToPdf

        protected void addOneImageToPdf(com.itextpdf.text.Image img,
                                com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfContentByte cb,
                                com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfWriter writer,
                                com.itextpdf.text.Document document,
                                boolean scaleImages)
                         throws com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        Add a single Image (either a JPG/GIF/PNG, or one page from a TIFF) to the given document (and its auxiliary writing objects).
        Parameters:
        img - Single-page image to add to the PDF
        cb - Direct Content into writer
        writer -
        document -
        scaleImages - boolean to determine if images should be scaled in the PDF
        Throws:
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException

      • imagesToPdf

        public java.io.OutputStream imagesToPdf(java.util.List input,
                                        java.lang.String output)
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Convert a given List of image filenames into a single output PDF file. The input files can be of any image type that iText currently supports, including JPEG, PNG, GIF, and TIFF (one-page only!). The output PDF will consist of each image being placed one per page in the order listed in the input List. They will be scaled to fit on a page if they are are larger than the set page size for the output PDF. The pdfaFormat variable in the imagesToPdf call will be automatically set to false, so a PDF/A-3b compliant PDF is not created.
        Parameters:
        input - a List of image filenames to be placed in the output PDF
        output - the filename of the output PDF
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • imagesToPdf

        public java.io.OutputStream imagesToPdf(java.util.List input,
                                        java.lang.String output,
                                        boolean scaleImages,
                                        boolean pdfaFormat,
                                        boolean createPdfInMemory)
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Convert a given List of image filenames into a single output PDF file. The input files can be of any image type that iText currently supports, including JPEG, PNG, GIF, and TIFF (one-page only!). The output PDF will consist of each image being placed one per page in the order listed in the input List. If scaleImages is true, they will be scaled to fit on a page if they are are larger than the set page size for the output PDF. Otherwise, the page size will be determined by the size of the image being added.
        Parameters:
        input - a List of image filenames to be placed in the output PDF
        output - the filename of the output PDF
        scaleImages - boolean to determine if images should be scaled in the PDF
        pdfaFormat - boolean to determine if pdf should be PDF/A-3b compliant
        createPdfInMemory - boolean to determine if the pdf should be written to a file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • imagesToPdf

        public java.io.OutputStream imagesToPdf(java.util.List input,
                                        java.lang.String output,
                                        boolean scaleImages,
                                        boolean pdfaFormat)
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Convert a given List of image filenames into a single output PDF file. The input files can be of any image type that iText currently supports, including JPEG, PNG, GIF, and TIFF (one-page only!). The output PDF will consist of each image being placed one per page in the order listed in the input List. If scaleImages is true, they will be scaled to fit on a page if they are are larger than the set page size for the output PDF. Otherwise, the page size will be determined by the size of the image being added.
        Parameters:
        input - a List of image filenames to be placed in the output PDF
        output - the filename of the output PDF
        scaleImages - boolean to determine if images should be scaled in the PDF
        pdfaFormat - boolean to determine if pdf should be PDF/A-3b compliant
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • imageToPdf

        public java.io.OutputStream imageToPdf(java.lang.String input,
                                       java.lang.String output)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                       com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Convert a given image filename into a single output PDF file. The input file can be of any image type that iText currently supports, including JPEG, PNG, GIF, and TIFF (one-page only!). The output PDF will consist of the image being placed on a single page. It will be scaled to fit if it is larger than the set page size for the output PDF. The pdfaFormat variable will automatically be set to false in the imagesToPdf call, so a PDF/A-3b compliant PDF is not created.
        Parameters:
        input - a single image filename
        output - the filename of the output PDF
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • imageToPdf

        public java.io.OutputStream imageToPdf(java.lang.String input,
                                       java.lang.String output,
                                       boolean scaleImages)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                       com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Overloads the imageToPdf method, passing in false for pdfaFormat to handle any cases in the module where imageToPdf is being called without this new paramater.
        Parameters:
        input - a single image filename
        output - the filename of the output PDF
        scaleImages - boolean to determine if images should be scaled in the PDF
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • imageToPdf

        public java.io.OutputStream imageToPdf(java.lang.String input,
                                       java.lang.String output,
                                       boolean scaleImages,
                                       boolean pdfaFormat)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                       com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Convert a given image filename into a single output PDF file. The input file can be of any image type that iText currently supports, including JPEG, PNG, GIF, and TIFF (one-page only!). The output PDF will consist of the image being placed on a single page. If scaleImages is true, it will be scaled to fit if it is larger than the set page size for the output PDF. Otherwise, the page size will be determined by the size of the image being added.
        Parameters:
        input - a single image filename
        output - the filename of the output PDF
        scaleImages - boolean to determine if images should be scaled in the PDF
        pdfaFormat - boolean to determine if pdf should be PDF/A-3b compliant
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • getPageSize

        public com.itextpdf.text.Rectangle getPageSize()

      • setPageSize

        public void setPageSize(com.itextpdf.text.Rectangle pagesize)
        Set the page size of the output PDF. This can be any of the sizes available in PageSize, or it can be your own custom size. If this method is not called, the default output size for PDFs is US Letter (com.lowagie.text.PageSize.LETTER).
        Parameters:
        pagesize - page size for ouput PDFs

      • setMargins

        public void setMargins(float margin)
        Set the margins on the page, given in points. This is a convenience function to set all 4 margins (top, bottom, left, right) to the same value. The size of the margin is given in points, where 1" = 72pts. By default, the margin is set to 0pts which is ideal for graphics that have a builtin margin.
        Parameters:
        margin - the width for all margins in points
